title.narrative: DIHR: Protection of Human Rights in China, 2011-2013

description.narrative:
The development objective of the programme is the increased realization of civil and social rights in China through new or revised legislation, increased public participation and access to justice, which will be achieved through close cooperation with six Chinese partners, and through the outcomes of the programme, in the form of legislative reform proposals advancing the protection of the rights of suspects and detainees, empowerment of migrant workers to claim their rights as well as capacity building of environmental Civil Society Organizations in China.
Regarding rights of suspects and detainees, two research reports on of death penalty and Re-education through Labour reforms, and one book on regulation of police investigative powers have been published. Two national research conferences with 140 participants all together, two round tables with legislators, and three training seminars for prosecutors and police with 630 participants in total were conducted. Research-based legislative recommendations were completed and submitted to legislators.
In the area of internal migrant worker's rights, 115 migrant workers received 6-12 months education to become community workers. Empirical research and interviews with migrant workers have been completed. 14 workshops and one seminar on migrant workers access to education and health care were held. Monthly e-newsletters, two research reports on migrant workers access to education and health care, and one popular book on the living and working conditions of migrant workers were published.
Lastly, The Environmental Advocacy Network was maintained. One steering committee meeting, one annual network conference with 38 participants, two training seminars with 80 participants in total, and one regional study trip to Taiwan and Hong Kong with 15 participants was completed.
